qas.question: How did the case against Tulisa fare?
What did the judge in the case state?

answers.text: Mahmood had lied at a pre-trial hearing and tried to manipulate evidence against the co-defendant Tulisa

qas.question: What type of drugs was Tulisa accused of supplying?
What action did The Sun take against Mahmood?
When was the case against Tulisa tried?

context: At her subsequent trial, the case against Tulisa <a0_0>collapsed<a0_0/> at Southwark Crown Court in <a4_0>July 2014<a4_0/>, with the judge commenting that there were "strong grounds" to believe that <a1_0>Mahmood had lied at a pre-trial hearing and tried to manipulate evidence against the co-defendant Tulisa<a1_0/>. Tulisa was cleared of supplying <a2_0>Class A drugs<a2_0/>. After these events, The Sun released a statement saying that the newspaper "takes the Judge's remarks very seriously. Mahmood has been <a3_0>suspended<a3_0/> pending an immediate internal investigation."
